caseStudies.title: DRINKR.
caseStudies.description: A mobile app to order drinks at bars.
caseStudies.role: Interviews & Research, Data Analysis, Usability Testing, UI Design
caseStudies.brief: Use research to find the pain points for bar-goers and understand how technology can improve their experience
caseStudies.team: Nico Mele, Benjamin Wong, Srimathy Karuppiah
caseStudies.skills: Interviews & Surveys, Research Synthesis, Competitor Analysis, Personas, Rapid Wireframing, Prototyping, Usability Testing, Design Iterations
caseStudies.tools: Paper & Pencil, Sketch, InVision, Google Forms

caseStudies.title: SES CALLOUT
caseStudies.description: A mobile app to collect and manage availability of SES volunteers.
caseStudies.role: Stakeholder Management, Interviews & Research, Usability Testing, UI Design
caseStudies.brief: NSW State Emergency Service (SES) is an emergency and rescue service dedicated to assisting the community with over 9,000 volunteers across the state. They currently donâ€™t have a system to collect availability from their volunteers and want to implement a mobile app to help with this. The mobile app would also help SES management with allocating volunteers to emergency jobs based on their availability
caseStudies.team: Nico Mele, Sabina Abdurahim, Pep Sayabath
caseStudies.skills: Interviews & Surveys, Research Synthesis, Empathy Mapping, Personas, Rapid Wireframing, Prototyping, Usability Testing, Design Iterations, Stakeholders Presentation
caseStudies.tools: Paper & Pencil, Google Forms, Axure, Loom
